passage:
(1) The Renaissance, a cultural movement that spanned roughly from the 14th to the 17th century, marked a period of significant transformation in European art and science. Beginning in Italy, this influential era brought about a renewed interest in classical learning and values that would forever change Western civilization.

(2) In the realm of art, Renaissance painters and sculptors broke away from medieval traditions. Artists like Leonardo da Vinci, Michelangelo, and Raphael developed techniques such as linear perspective, realistic human anatomy, and chiaroscuro (the use of light and shadow). These innovations allowed artists to create more lifelike and three-dimensional representations, establishing new standards for beauty and realism.

(3) The Renaissance also witnessed remarkable advancements in architecture. Inspired by classical Roman designs, architects such as Filippo Brunelleschi created magnificent structures featuring domes, columns, and symmetrical proportions. The Florence Cathedral's dome, completed in 1436, stands as a testament to both artistic vision and technical achievement of the period.

(4) Scientific inquiry flourished during the Renaissance as scholars began to examine the natural world through observation and experimentation rather than relying solely on ancient texts. Nicolaus Copernicus challenged the long-accepted geocentric model of the universe, proposing that the Earth revolves around the sun. Later, Galileo Galilei's telescopic observations provided evidence supporting this heliocentric view, fundamentally changing humanity's understanding of our place in the cosmos.

(5) Perhaps most importantly, the Renaissance embodied a spirit of humanism that placed value on human capabilities and achievements. This perspective encouraged individuals to pursue knowledge across multiple disciplines. The concept of the "Renaissance man" – exemplified by figures like Leonardo da Vinci who excelled in art, science, engineering, and more – reflects how this era celebrated human potential and curiosity. This interdisciplinary approach to learning established a foundation for modern education and continues to influence our understanding of knowledge today.

questions.question: Which sentence uses the correct form of the verb?

options.B: She have been to London twice.
options.D: We was watching TV when she called.

questions.question: Choose the correct preposition to complete the sentence: "I'm looking forward _____ seeing you next week."
Select the correct comparative form: "This book is _____ than the one I read last month."
Which sentence contains a correct conditional structure?

options.A: If I will see him, I will tell him.
options.B: If I see him, I will tell him.
options.C: If I would see him, I will tell him.
options.D: If I see him, I would tell him.

questions.question: Choose the correct past tense form: "She _____ to the store yesterday."
Identify the correct passive voice construction: "The cake _____ by my mother."
Select the correct modal verb: "You _____ see a doctor if your fever doesn't go down."
Choose the correct article: "I saw _____ interesting movie last night."
Which sentence uses the correct verb tense?

options.A: I am knowing him for five years.
options.B: I know him for five years.
options.C: I have known him for five years.
options.D: I have been know him for five years.

questions.question: Select the correct possessive form: "That book belongs to my sister. It is _____."
Which sentence uses the correct form of the gerund?

options.A: He enjoys to swim in the ocean.
options.B: She admitted to stealing the cookies.
options.C: They finished to write their essays.
options.D: I look forward to see you soon.

Select the correct sentence structure:

options.A: Always she arrives early to class.
options.B: She always arrives early to class.
options.C: She arrives always early to class.
options.D: She arrives early always to class.

options.A: By the time he arrived, we left.
options.B: By the time he arrived, we had left.
options.C: By the time he had arrived, we left.
options.D: By the time he has arrived, we had left.

options.C: Thanks a lot. That was very kind of you.

questions.question: What does the word 'targets' mean in the sentence: "The company set ambitious sales targets for the next quarter."?

Choose the correct meaning of 'besides' in this context: "Besides English, she also speaks French and German."

options.C: The act of descending to the ground

According to paragraph 1, where did the Renaissance begin?
Based on paragraph 2, which technique allowed Renaissance artists to create more three-dimensional representations?

What important concept did Nicolaus Copernicus challenge, according to the passage?

options.B: The geocentric model of the universe

options.B: The use of perspective in art
options.D: The geocentric model of the universe
